intro: Blakea multiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered Blakea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its striking white, showy flowers that bloom in clusters along the stems. It typically grows as an upright shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Blakea multiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its elegant appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
